meanings.definition: A nonessential amino acid that is a constituent of most proteins.
meanings.sent1: Alanin is important for building proteins in the body.
meanings.sent2: Most proteins contain alanin as a key component.
meanings.sent3: The little alanin molecule was always the life of the protein party.
meanings.sent4: In the world of proteins, alanin is like the glue that holds everything together.
meanings.sent5: Imagine alanin as the building blocks that create the strong structure of proteins.

meanings.definition: A crystalline amino acid that is a constituent of most proteins.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the structure of alanin crystals under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: The crystalline form of alanin is commonly found in protein structures.
meanings.sent3: The shiny alanin crystal sparkled like a precious gem in the protein mix.
meanings.sent4: The purity of alanin crystals reflects the purity of protein structures.
meanings.sent5: Each alanin crystal is like a tiny piece of the protein puzzle, fitting perfectly into place.
